response.name: JSON representing an E-receipt and its associated metadata.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

response.body:
{
  "links": [
    {
      "href": "commodo eu",
      "method": "ut nulla aute",
      "rel": "ad eu laborum id"
    },
    {
      "href": "dolor non esse ex",
      "method": "pariatur enim esse",
      "rel": "Lorem fugiat adipisicing eu qui"
    }
  ],
  "modifiedAt": "<string>",
  "companyId": "<string>",
  "dateTimeReceived": "<string>",
  "entityId": "<string>",
  "validationSchema": "http://schema.concursolutions.com/car-rental-receipt.schema.json",
  "receipt": {},
  "image": "<string>",
  "userId": "<string>",
  "id": "<string>",
  "digitizationStatus": "PROCESSING",
  "forwardId": {},
  "self": "<string>",
  "template": "<string>"
}

item.name: Receipts for a user by state

request.description: Get all v4 image-only receipts for a single user with a certain state. Valid states are consumable (not attached to an expense report), consumed (attached), and discarded (deleted by the user). Maximum 50 receipts per page. If there are more results after the first page, a next page link will be provided in the results.  Calling that link will retrieve the next page of receipts.

response.name: JSON representing the receipts owned by this user. If no receipts are found for this user, an empty array of receipts is returned.

response.name: Callers must provide a valid JWT and/or Concur-issued X.509 client certificate

formdata.description: (Required) The receipt image
Metadata about the capture of a paper receipt. Required for special GRDC processing rules to take effect. This parameter should be JSON. Please see the model for clientData for more details.

A user provided string of up to 40 characters used to identify a receipt submission. Should be unique from the  perspective of the client application. If a receipt is submitted with a forwardId that already exists in the system for that particular client, the request will be rejected with a 304 Not Modified response. This helps prevent duplicate receipt submissions from mobile clients.

request.description: Create a new image-only receipt. Image-only receipts consist of an image without the JSON data that is included with E-receipts.

response.name: The receipt has been accepted and will be processed soon.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

formdata.description: (Required) The receipt image
Metadata about the capture of a paper receipt. Required for special GRDC processing rules to take effect. This parameter should be JSON. Please see the model for clientData for more details.

A user provided string of up to 40 characters used to identify a receipt submission. Should be unique from the  perspective of the client application. If a receipt is submitted with a forwardId that already exists in the system for that particular client, the request will be rejected with a 304 Not Modified response. This helps prevent duplicate receipt submissions from mobile clients.

description.content: The URL location of the receipt. This link will return a 404 until the receipt has finished processing. After the receipt has finished processing, the receipt data will be available at this URL.

Contains a link to status information about the receipt. Receipt processing happens asynchronously, so calling this link can provide information about the receipt if it has not yet shown up at the URL from the Location header.

response.name: The forwardId provided was already present in the system, indicating a duplicate receipt submission.

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: apikey
(Required) A link to the E-receipt schema to be used to validate the incoming E-receipt data. Retrieve the list of schemas from the GET schemas route.

formdata.description: (Required) The JSON data for the receipt
The image for this E-receipt. If no image is submitted, one will be generated automatically based on the JSON data.

request.description: Create a new E-receipt for a user.

response.name: The receipt has been accepted and will be processed soon.

header.description: (Required) A link to the E-receipt schema to be used to validate the incoming E-receipt data. Retrieve the list of schemas from the GET schemas route.
Added as a part of security scheme: apikey

formdata.description: (Required) The JSON data for the receipt
The image for this E-receipt. If no image is submitted, one will be generated automatically based on the JSON data.

description.content: The URL location of the receipt. This link will return a 404 until the receipt has finished processing. After the receipt has finished processing, the receipt data will be available at this URL.

Contains two links: one with `rel="describedBy"` and one with `rel="processing-status"`. The describedBy link represents the JSON schema that was used to validate the receipt when it was submitted. This is the same link that was provided in the `schema` header in the request. The processing-status link can be called for status information about the receipt. Receipt processing happens asynchronously, so calling this link can provide information about the receipt if it has not yet shown up at the URL from the Location header.

response.name: Bad request. The request was malformed or lacked required fields.
